mobs.LongDesc: Head Tounament Judge, Tom Wylie, makes sure you know the rules.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is the head judge of the tournament. Any decision he makes is the final word - he is God here.
He notices your interest in the tournament and points to the sign on the wall stating the tournament rules.
You know that to break these rules is to incur his wrath.

mobs.LongDesc: A warrior in blackened armor awaits your challenge.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Though he's no larger than you, the man who startes out at you from under
his helmet's visor shows no fear of your power. From the way he carries his
jagged sword, and spiked shield, you doubt that they ever leave his hands.
He's ready for you, and as you approach, he intones:
   My power is as vast as the plains,
   My strength is that of mountains,
   Each wave that crashes upon the shore,
   Thunders like blood in my veins.

mobs.LongDesc: A four-armed beast with glowing eyes stalks toward you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The guardian beast was created by a powerful wizard to guard his most prized
posessions. While the beast lives, no one can touch these most valuable
artifacts. The beast is ever vigilant, and never needs food or rest. If you
want its treasure, you must kill it.

mobs.LongDesc: In the darkness you see a skull looking at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Wearing dark clothing on its humanoid form, the only prominant feature of
the Khabal Ghoul is its yellowed skull. Drawing energy from the death of other
beings, the ghoul is most deadly in areas of great carnage.

mobs.LongDesc: A powerful efreet is flying around, free of his bottle.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
With black hair and a green complexion, the efreet hardly looks
intimidating. His ease of movement throught the air and the aura of greenish
energy that surrounds him makes up for his whimsical appearance.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge statue towers over you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Over 100 feet tall, this is easily the largest moving object you've ever met
up with. Originally meant to stand watch over the entrance to the harbor of
Sardia, some wizard thought that by animating it, he would have an unstoppable
killing machine. It looks like he was right.

mobs.LongDesc: A bearded, kingly man with a staff watches you haughtily
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Every bit the Arabian king, Suleiman is dressed in purple, and adorned with
gold. He appears well-fed, and highly refined, with an air of kingly dignity
to him. He is renoun for his power over the djinn and efreeti that are so
powerful in his native realm.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge, green, horned Djinn towers over you and grins.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This monster you swallow you whole if he ever got ahold of you. His pupiless
eyes stare at you, and his muscular green frame tenses for combat. The large
gold nose-ring, and tiny goatee only enhance his sinister appearance, and
heighten your fear.

mobs.LongDesc: Gaea's Avenger seeks to destroy the artificers.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A being created from the material of the earth itself, Gaea's Avenger
gathers its strength from its rage at the defiling of Nature. Its purpose in
existing it to destroy those whose artifice corrupted the land, and reclaim
Nature for Gaea's creatures.

mobs.LongDesc: A disgusting Atog scavenges for artifacts.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Atog is a boulder-sized, mushroom-shaped, purple creature, with glowing
orange eyes and a mouth that takes up most of its body. Once used by wizards
to dispose of dangerous artifacts, the Atogs gained power from the artifacts
they ate and destoyed their masters. Now, as a race of their own, they have
become the bane of all artificers.

mobs.LongDesc: An archaeologist is picking through the ruins, looking for artifacts
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The archaeologist is a middle-aged man with unkempt blond hair and glasses.
He's on his knees marking out an excavation site with little wooden stakes and
string. He's so intent on his work that he is completely ignoring you.

mobs.LongDesc: You see a man who begins to look like you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
When you first see Halfdane, he appears as a heavy-set, bearded Norseman.
However, as you look at him, he grins and begins to take your shape. This
fight you may end up[ battling yourself.

mobs.LongDesc: A strange red and black-faced man stands here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Johan is one of the greatest generals ever to have lived. He is as famous
for his red face-paint, and his horned, blue battle gear as he is for his
amazing hit and run tactics, that leave his troops in primedefensive positions
after an attack.

mobs.LongDesc: An assassin stalks you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Ramses Overdark is a fearsome bringer of death. Despite his spiked, demonic
armor he is silent and invisible as death. His helm obscures any human
features behind red glowing eyes, spider mandibles, and scorpion tails. He is
renoun for his ability to track anything that is enchanted with magic.

mobs.LongDesc: A man in clerical robes nods at your presence.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Rasputin Dreamweaver is an elder cleric. Dressed in simple robes, and with a
beard that suggests great age, he puts forth an image of a gruff but kindly
priest. The staff he carries is rumored to hold powerful healing magic, but
anyone who has seen it used must have died of old age long ago.

mobs.LongDesc: An invincible-looking giant stands in your way.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
With the craw giant's physique, and human would be formidable. When you take
into account that the giant's muscles are made of stone, you shudder to think
of the damage he could cause. The giant seems good-natured enough, laughing
heartily at the sight of an armed group approaching. Looking at your own
weapons and back to him, you be inclined to agree with his opinion of your
odds.

mobs.LongDesc: A little wombat is here, frothing at the mouth.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Wombats are generally considered to be fairly harmless creatures. Ever
wonder what happens when you expose them to magic? ,,,probably not. Well,
wombats go completely insane when enchanted, and the more magic effecting
them, the crazier --and more powerful-- they get. This little fella looks
pretty magicked-up...

mobs.LongDesc: A group of berserkers waits for you to make the first move.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Aerathi Berserkers are a fierce group who revel in carnage. They fight
bare-chested, shunning armor, and wield huge axes, stained with blood. The
wear their hair long and unbound, and braid their moustaches.

mobs.LongDesc: A wild efreet flies around you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The efreet's body is only corporeal from the waist up. It's head is bald
except for a top-knot of long purple hair. Two thin horns curve up from the
side, and its pupiless eyes stare right through you. You can't be certain what
this acrane creature wants with you, or even if it's really aware that you're
here.

mobs.LongDesc: An Akron Legionnaire stands guard here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Akron Legionnaire wears the traditional garb of his order. He wears a
yellow tabard emblazoned with a red sunburst, and black plate armor on his
arms and legs. His helmet is also black with only a "T"-shaped slot revealing
the eyes and nose, and two downturned prongs jutting from the sides.

mobs.LongDesc: Some kind of creature is devouring corpses.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Eater of the Dead is a repugnant creature. It has a fanged, dog-like
face, with horns ressembling those of a bull. It survives solely on the flesh
and bones of dead creatures, even the remnants of animated corpses. It is
believed that anything other than carrion would be poisonous to the Eater.

mobs.LongDesc: The legendary Leviathan drifts slowly through the water.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The very name "Leviathan" means huge. In this case, it is an
underestimation. Swimming slowly through the water near the sunken city, the
Leviathan could easily _swallow_ the entire city! the only thing you'd have in
your favor in fighting it, it that there is so much room inside it that you
could survive being swallowed.

mobs.LongDesc: Several camouflaged men hide nearby.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
With their bodies painted to camouflage themselves with the forest, the
Scarwood Bandits are all but invisible. They prey on those who travel in the
woodlands without enough guards. Beware your posessions around these rogues.

mobs.LongDesc: A ball of lightning flashes toward you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lightning is one of the most destructive forces of nature...or at least the
quickest destructive force of nature. Wizards have found a way to conjure up
the rarest and most dangerous form of lightning--Ball Lightning. While the
ball lightning may not bedurable like conjured creatures are, it provides a
quick and decisive blow against a foe.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge, winged demon rises up to slay you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Many a wizard has called upon such a beast only to be slain by it. The Lord
of the Pit is among the most powerful of demons. It's bulky frame sppears
skeletal, with reddish-black skin stretched tightly over its bones. Its long
arms have wings extended from them, and its hands are little more than vicious
claws. It turns its horned head toward you, and the look in its dull red eyes
lets you know that you mean little more to it than a meal.

mobs.LongDesc: A horde of demons ravages the countryside.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
About a thousand knee-high demons are rioting across the land, destroying
everything in their path. Completely black except for razor-sharp white fangs
and glowing red eyes, they shriek in glee when they see you. You contemplate
just how those teeth will feel as they rend the flesh from your bones.

mobs.LongDesc: A juggernaut is rumbling over everything in its path, to squish you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Juggernaut consists of a huge, wheeled platform with a totem statue on it.
The "wheels" of the platform are more like giant, spiked rollers, designed to
crush anything that gets in the juggernauts path. This particular juggernaut
seems magically enchanted to propell itself, unlike normal ones which are
pulled by hordes of slaves.

mobs.LongDesc: An assassin slips stealthily from shadow to shadow.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A ragged looking older man with an eye-patch, this assassin hardly seems the
ruthless murderer his title would indicate. Then again, if all killers looked
like killers, then criminal justice would be much simpler. Rodent-like men
such as this one can be invaluable tools to the ambitious and powerful.

mobs.LongDesc: A man made of brass awaits someone's command.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A crudely build mechanical man, the brass man requires a continual supply of
mana to function. Built out of what look to be the spare parts of a tuba and a
washtub, it must have taken some ingenuity to even make it walk.

mobs.LongDesc: A black knight on a horse charges toward you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Seemingly right out of the midieval tales of chivalry, the black knight
wears black armor, and rides a black horse. Though honorable, the black knight
lives to kill and dominate. A perversion of the knightly code, all goodly
knights will challenge the black knight whenever they encounter him.

mobs.LongDesc: A beautiful woman with glowing red eyes glares haughtily at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Sorceress Queen is a beautiful, but evil, woman. She has thick, dark
hair and a full figure. The only odd thing about her appearance is the fact
that her eyes are red. The red eyes might be the result of dark-elf heritage,
which would also explain her magical prowess. She wears skpimy clothing that
leaves little to the imagination, and only a tiny crown indicates her royal
status.

mobs.LongDesc: Some sort of phantom flies around.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
An amorphous creature, the Phantom Monster changes shape to suit the fears
of its enemies. While is may seem to be non-corporeal, you'll think otherwise
when those "phantasmal" teeth bite into you.

mobs.LongDesc: A green man with a long beard walks by.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Gaea's Liege is the most powerful of Gaea's mortal followers. His duty is to
reclaim the wilderness from civilization. Through his magic he can grow trees
in even the most inhospitable climates. Wizards have often manipulated the
liege to turn lands controlled by their opponents into forests, thus
corrupting their mana.

mobs.LongDesc: The force of nature has taken an avatar.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Force of Nature is a greenish, roughly humanoid figure that looks like
it could crush boulders with its bare hands. The more distinctive of human
features are blurred on its bulk. In fact, it gives the impression of a burly
football player wearing a trash bag over his body.

mobs.LongDesc: An incredibly huge warrior trudges toward you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This huge warrior looks like he's on steroids. His muscles are impossibly
large for a human. He goes around bare-chested, wearing a monster's horned
head for a helmet. He is carrying a sword that is thicker than one of your
legs and as long as a grown man's body.

mobs.LongDesc: A six-headed rock hydra roars as you draw near.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Hydras are akin to dragons. They are large vicious lizards with many heads.
The more heads the hydra has, the older, and more powerful it is. Fortunately,
hydras are unlike dragons, in that they can't breath fire.

mobs.LongDesc: A red dragon swoops down at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Known for its cruelty, the Shivan Dragon is one of the most fearsome
creatures known. Upon hearing it's shriek, every wilderness creature goes into
hiding. The Shivan does mind the inconvenience of having to chase down its
prey; it enjoys the fear that its mere presence inspires.

mobs.LongDesc: A warrior woman watches you and prepares for battle.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Dressed in a leather jerkin and wearing her hair short, she could easily be
mistaken for a man from behind. The Benalish are a war-like people, and any of
them is formidable in combat.

mobs.LongDesc: A holy warrior from the north stands here stoically.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The paladin is a noble being. Devoting his life to the protection of others,
he is willing to sacrifice his life even for a complete stranger. Dressed in
chain mail and wearing a tabard that bears his god's holy symbol, the Northern
Paladin is always ready to do battle.

mobs.LongDesc: An incarnation of one of the wizards prepares fight for its master.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A glowing, yellow field of energy formed by the magic and life force of a
wizard stands before you. Armed with sword and shield, this deadly avatar can
draw upon the power of the wizard who created it to heal its wounds. Though
physically strong, the incarnation can be dangerous for a wizard to use. The
wizard's lifeforce becomes entwined with the incarnation, and he loses some of
his lifeforce if it is destroyed.

mobs.LongDesc: A haughty angel looks down at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
With long, golden hair, large feathery wings, and tanned skin, the Serra
Angel is quite beautiful. She is wearing a simple gown, and carries a golden
sword sheathed at her hip. Don't be fooled by her appearance; she is a
powerful warrior for the cause of goodness, and knows how to use her sword
with great efficiency.

mobs.LongDesc: A white knight on a horse charges toward you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Seemingly right out of the midieval tales of chivalry, the white knight
wears white armor, and rides a white horse. With his sword gleaming in the
sunlight, he charges into battle to fight the forces of evil. Ever on the
look-out for evil, the White Knight will fight with all his heart against any
knight that has forsaken his oath and turned to evil.

mobs.LongDesc: Some sort of winged,  clockwork insect is flying around.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You're not quite sure what to make  of this clockwork being. It doesn't
look like any living  creature you've ever encountered. It flutters around
for a while, then looks at you. You feel somewhat disoriented, and then
realize that the  sun has moved in the sky. This creature just transported
you through time!

mobs.LongDesc: The leader of the sand warriors watches you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Dressed in the garb of a desert raider and armed with
a pair of scimitars, Hazezon looks quite fearsome. He commands a
band of sand warriors who are the scourge of the deserts.
His followers will come to his aid in times of need, and are
ready and willing to give their lives for their beloved leader.

mobs.LongDesc: A sand warrior is here to aid Hazezon Tamar.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Camouflaged in the colors of the desert sands, this
stealthy warrior could walk right past you in the desert without
you ever noticing. His master, Hazezon Tamar, will always find him close by in times of need.

mobs.LongDesc: Some goblin raiders snarl at you, but don't dare attack.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Among the varied races, goblins recruit more of their population into the
military than any other. It's ironic though, that they are one of the most
poorly suited races to the art of war. They are unruly, stupid, and more
vicious to each other than to any enemy.

mobs.LongDesc: A bunch of goblins with shovels are hanging around.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Being subterranean creatures, there is a lot of demand for new tunnels,
which the digging teams build. When pressed into military service, they tumble
the walls of the opposing armies. Not being terribly clever creatures, they
often topple those walls down onto themselves.

mobs.LongDesc: A goblin that appears to be some sort of surgeon is here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
While many of the finer arts of civilization are completely lacking amongthe
goblins, not so with surgery. Goblin surgical techniques may be grizzly, and
disgusting --usually involving using one goblin as spare parts for another--
but they are definitely effective. You've noticed that many of the goblins
around here sport limbs that don't appear to fit quite right. Now you know
why. The limb undoubtedly started out belonging to some other hapless goblin.

mobs.LongDesc: Some kind of goblin shaman or wizard is chanting something odd.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Every race has its superstitions. To go along with those superstitions comes
someone smartenough to exploit them. While it doesn't take much to fool a
goblin, their wizards do actually have to know some magic to gain acceptance
as someone of importance in the clan.

mobs.LongDesc: The goblin version of a hero is lounging around.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Hmmm, decent weapons...armor appears functional...even seems to know which
end of his sword to hold. Perhaps you've finally found a competant goblin. You
meet its gaze and notice the dull look in its eyes. Then you dismiss your
silly delusions about competant goblins.

mobs.LongDesc: A mutated goblin sulks here, shunned by the others.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
What has three heads, two arms, and half a brain? A Goblin Mutant. They are
most likely the result of the goblin wizards' frequent attempts to "improve"
the goblin race. They are big and strong, and dumb as dirt.

mobs.LongDesc: Some pathetic creature limps along miserably.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Basal Thrulls were bred by wizards to be infused with mana. When sacrificed,
they release that mana in a form useable to the wizard. Hideously deformed,
they were shunned by other beings, and left to their doom at the hands of the
wizards. Eventually an uprising among the thrulls won their freedom--and their
masters' deaths.

mobs.LongDesc: A nasty, spiked creature cowers as you approach.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Armor Thrulls were bred by wizards to have a hard, spiked carapace, ideal
for the making of armor. Many a wizard's mercenary soldier has been made to
wear a dead armor thrull into battle. If they knew how tough they were, armor
thrulls could be dangerous.

mobs.LongDesc: A hideously deformed creature stumbles about.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Mindstab Thrulls were designed to attack another wizard's mind. The suicide
of a mindstab thrull causes any nearby wizard immense mental pain, resulting
in the loss of some of his spells from memory. If the wizards that created the
mindstab thrulls had any sense, they would have found a way to protect
themselves from the effect. When the thrulls rebelled, the sacrifice of the
mindstabs made all the difference.
   This particular little creature seems to be made entirely out of arms,
stitched together, and supporting a head.

mobs.LongDesc: A really scarry-looking creature grins as you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Necrites are the assassins of the thrulls. When they were first created
by the wizards,they would gladly give their lives to destroy one of the
wizards' enemies. They're fearsome appearance allowed them to literally scare
their victims to death. It wasn't until the thrull rebellion that the necrites
realized that their gruesome powers could be used on their creators.

mobs.LongDesc: A warrior thrull flicks its tongue out and hisses at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
With four arms, three faces of fanged teeth and bulging eyes, and a
serpentine body, the Thrull Champion was bred for combat. A forked tongue
flicks out at you, waiting for you to give some indication that you want to
fight. The champion may be proficient in combat, but it is still too cowardly
to start a fight on its own.

mobs.LongDesc: A group of soldiers guard the town.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
While a peace-loving folk, the Icatians are beseiged by armies of the more
warlike races on a regular basis. As a result, they have a rather large
standing army for a farming town.

mobs.LongDesc: A group of soldiers carrying javelins patrol the streets.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Icatian army is well-known for its javelineers. Used as a first-strike
weapon, the javelins decimate an enemy's ranks before they even close to melee
distance with the main Icatian army. As a result, the javelineers are well
respected among the citizenry.

mobs.LongDesc: An officer in the Icatian military surveys his troops.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The officers in the Icatian army are the cream of the crop. Far too
practical to sell commissions, or give out the positions as political favors,
the Ications impose rigorous standards on their military leadership. Their
officers must conform to the highest standards of competance, honor, and
integrity. Their survival depends on it.

mobs.LongDesc: A forward scout for the Icatians surveys the terrain.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Little more than a boy, this scout is doing his duty to his homeland.
Camouflaging himself in the terrain, the scout watches for signs of invaders
coming toward his town in Icatia.

mobs.LongDesc: A man on a flying carpet flies by you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Dressed in the garb of an Arabian warrior and flying on a carpet, you're so
struck by the fantastic appearance of the man that you almost forget what a
potential threat he is. Armed with a scimitar, he could be very troublesome,
if he decided to fly circles around you while he attacked.

mobs.LongDesc: A machine made to look like a dragon rumbles toward you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This construction is basically a hollowed out metal statue of a dragon that
has had machinery put into it. A motorizedand magically powered set of wheels
propells italong the ground, and an ominous spout pokes out between its teeth,
presumably to shoot flames.

mobs.LongDesc: A bunch of little gremlins swarm toward the nearest machine.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
To wizards they are the most a annoying creatures in existance. Gremlins in
general like to make nuisances of themselves, and Phyrexian Gremlins are
particularly adept with magical constructs. Climbing in and a mong the gears,
they can disable any artifact and prevent its repair for as long as they
remain.

mobs.LongDesc: A man dressed as a sorcerer smiles at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Wearing a puffy purple hat and sporting a little goatee, the prodigal
sorcerer looks a bit silly. An amatuer wizard, he makes his living selling his
skills to wizards who want some extra firepower.

mobs.LongDesc: A carzy old hermit looks at you with wild eyes.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Driven into the woods years ago by his disgust with humanity, Istvan seems
to have little humanity left in him. He doesn't seem to goom himself, since
his hair is full of leaves and dirst, and his tangled beard reaches his knees.
He gives you a sort of wild, snarling look, and you wonder if there is any
reasoning with this madman.

mobs.LongDesc: An army of ants scavenges for food.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Larger than any ants you've ever seen, the Carrion Ants are a force to be
reckoned with. These ants don't go after picnic food, they prefer to feed on
humanoid corpses, which they are fully capable of gathering themselves.

mobs.LongDesc: An old man wearing rags shambles along.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
With his features hidden behind a cowl of rags, the Rag Man can easily be
mistaken for a living creature. He is not. Once he was a powerful necromancer,
dealing in the magicks of death. The magic eventually consumed him, leaving
him a disgusting thing of death and decay. Now he prowls the streets of
cities, and the nightmares of children, stalking...

mobs.LongDesc: A pack of cat warriors surrounds you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Striped like tigers, the Cat Warriors wear green cloaks to help them hide in
the forest, which they do extremely well. They can stalk through the forest so
silently as not to disturb the birds. Watch your back, they might be right
behind you.

mobs.LongDesc: Some tiny sprites flitter around you, trailing fire.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Like all sprites, the Fire Sprites are mischevious little things. With their
innate ability to produce flame, they often harrass people by singeing the
tips of their ears and noses. Generally consideredto be a harmless buisance,
most people do their best to ingore the sprites. Getting upset at them only
encourages theis behavior.

mobs.LongDesc: A group of men is here, waiting to be martyred.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A sort of doomsday cult, the Martyrs of Korlis wish to be remembered in
glory. Believing that they are doomed anyway, they will save anyone from
anything. When wandering by a battle, the Martyrs have been known to throw
themselves into the fray and put themselves between a sword and its intended
victim. They have also been known to arrange for people's lives to be put in
danger, just so they can die gloriously by saving them.

mobs.LongDesc: A wizard's apprentice wanders by you, absent-mindedly.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Appreantice Wizard looks like he's trying real hard to seem like a
full-fledged wizard. He's wearing elaborate robes, and a bit, wide-brimmed,
pointy mage hat. You'd guess that he is a rich merchant or nobleman's son that
paid some down-on-his-luck wizard to let him be an apprentice.

mobs.LongDesc: A grim archer woman nocks an arrow.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You see a female archer with a high-quality bow. Seemingly well at easy with
her weapon, you suspect that she could shoot you dead where you stand if you
crossed her. Her quiver is full of arrows, and she appears to be ready to
defend herself against whatever violent intentions you have.

mobs.LongDesc: A caribou is grazing peacefully.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A herd creature, the caribou are the food source
for many nomadic tribes. Their combat ability is virtually
non-existant.

mobs.LongDesc: Lisa Ramoana Aservathos
mobs.DetailedDesc:
38 24 and a real nice ass the configuration of this goddess.
Brunet hair about shloulder length and a tan that make will make you glad
to have eyes.

mobs.LongDesc: Fransica Ivan Rivera
mobs.DetailedDesc:
36-26-36
THANK GOD FOR HISPANICS Iee Krumba !!
present miss latina this woman is definatly something to look at.
standing about 5ft 6 she is definately something to write home about
